text: Euphorbia antiquorum is a xerophyte announced by Carl von Linné and later described by León Croizat as Euphorbia mayuranathanii in honour to Indian botanist Pallassana Vaithipattar Mayurnathan, who gathered in Madras; It is common on the Indian subcontinent, in Pakistan, Thailand, and Myanmar. It is a succulent. It occurs in areas up to about above sea level. no var iety is recognized jet i.e. E a. var polygona Wight त्रिधार Hindi name ==References== Category:Euphorbiaceae Category:Medicinal plants Category:Plants of Asia
title: Euphorbia antiquorum
